meanings.definition: In a dull and uninteresting manner.
meanings.sent1: The lecture proceeded boringly, making many students yawn.
meanings.sent2: She spoke so boringly that even the most attentive listeners struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so boringly predictable that I could guess the ending within the first few minutes.
meanings.sent4: Time passed boringly, like watching paint dry on a wall.
meanings.sent5: The party dragged on boringly, with no exciting activities to liven it up.

meanings.definition: In a tedious and monotonous way.
meanings.sent1: The assembly line moved boringly, with the same repetitive tasks every day.
meanings.sent2: He read the manual so boringly that it felt like listening to a robot.
meanings.sent3: The clock ticked boringly, marking each passing second with a monotonous rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell boringly, creating a constant and unchanging sound on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The music played boringly, lacking any variation or excitement to capture the audience's attention.
